raw_comment:
1. Noticed that there were many countries that were placed above the lne. Thus, younger people tended to have a more positive outlook for the future than older people.
2. What would the graph look like 20, 40, or 60 years in the past? What will it look like in the future? Also, how does Indonesia manage to give happiness to both young and old?
3. This relates to myself and my community because I can see, from this graph, how the coming generations see the world compared to the past generations.
4. Are there better days ahead for the young and old?
ace_sentences: I noticed that many countries were above the line.
Younger people tended to have a more positive outlook for the future than older people.
I ask what the graph looked like 20 years in the past.
I ask what the graph looked like 40 years in the past.
I ask what the graph looked like 60 years in the past.
I ask what the graph will look like in the future.
I ask how Indonesia manages to give happiness to young people and old people.
This relates to me and my community.
From this graph, I can see how the coming generations see the world.
From this graph, I can see how the past generations see the world.
I ask if there are better days ahead for young people and old people.
